==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=将|alt=摪,𢪇,𢪽,𤕭,獎}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|爿|肉|alt2=⺼|t1=bed; small table|t2=meat|寸|t3=hand|ls=psc|c1=p|c2=s|c3=s}} – to offer meat as tribute by putting it on the table.

The {{lang|zh|⺼}} component is on its side, hence resembles {{zh-l|*夕}} with an added dot; compare {{zh-l|*祭}}, {{zh-l|*然}}.

''{{w|Shuowen}}'' considers the phonetic component of {{lang|zh|將}} to be {{och-l|醬|sauce}} (abbreviated).

===Etymology===
A conflation of two roots: “to take; to hold” and “will; be going to; near”.

;“to take; to hold” (Pronunciations 1, 2 and 3)
Sino-Tibetan: compare {{cog|bo|འཆང||to hold, to keep, to carry}}.

;“will; be going to; near” (Pronunciation 1)
Austroasiatic: compare {{cog|km|ចង់||to want, to wish; to approach, to draw near; about to (do something), on the point of}} < {{cog|mkh-okm|caṅa||to wish, to want}}. Cognate with {{och-l|且|about to; on the point of; moreover; also}} ({{zh-ref|Wu, 2015}}).
